title: Game Theory – Prisoner’s Dilemma
description: Explore self-interest vs. collective interest; dominance and inefficiency.

questions.question: The payoff ranking in Prisoner’s Dilemma is:
Each player’s dominant strategy is to:
questions.explanation: Defection dominates irrespective of the other’s move.

questions.question: The Nash equilibrium outcome is:
questions.explanation: (D, D) with mutual defection is NE.

questions.question: Why is the outcome inefficient?
options: (C, C) would give both higher payoffs than (D, D)
questions.explanation: Dominance leads to a worse joint outcome.

questions.question: Repeated interaction can:
questions.explanation: Future punishment threats can support cooperation.

questions.question: A real-world example of PD is:
questions.explanation: Undercutting is individually rational but hurts profits jointly.

questions.question: Which policy can resolve PD in society?
Which statement is TRUE?
options: Individual rationality can harm collective welfare

questions.question: If δ is high in an infinitely repeated PD, cooperation is:
questions.explanation: Patience (high δ) raises value of future rewards/punishments.
